message.content:
cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.MA, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with multi-armed bandit problems, which are a classic problem in machine learning and optimization. The focus is on social groups and communication, which suggests that the paper may belong to the sub-categories of machine learning (cs.LG), social and information networks (cs.SI), and social computing (cs.SOC). The use of mean-field approximation method from statistical physics suggests that the paper may also belong to the sub-categories of multi-agent systems (cs.MA) and information theory (cs.IT).
